articles.title: How Rising Wildfire Risks Are Rewiring the Future of Power Systems
articles.summary: The article discusses the growing risks of wildfires in power systems, particularly in the United States. Rising wildfire threats are being attributed to various factors, including drought, climate change, and maintenance issues with transmission lines. The consequences of these fires can be devastating, as seen in recent cases such as the 2018 Camp Fire in California.

articles.title: Coherency Control in Power Systems
articles.summary: The article proposes a coherency control strategy for Inverter-Based Resources (IBRs) to establish coherence among power system devices. This control enforces an output current with a proportional magnitude and constant phase shift relative to a reference, making it technology-agnostic. Case studies demonstrate its potential to improve damping and overall dynamic behavior in modern power systems.

articles.title: Neural Operators for Power Systems: A Physics-Informed Framework for Modeling Power System Components
articles.summary:

 The article proposes a neural-operator framework, called Physics-Informed DeepONets (PI-DeepONets), for surrogate modeling of power system components. This framework uses Deep Operator Networks to learn mappings from system states and time-varying inputs to full trajectories without step-by-step integration. PI-DeepONets achieve accurate predictions under diverse scenarios, providing a significant speedup compared to classical ODE solvers.

articles.title: Strategic Decision-Making Under Uncertainty through Bi-Level Game Theory and Distributionally Robust Optimization
articles.summary: The article proposes a mathematical framework that integrates bi-level game theory with distributionally robust optimization to address uncertainty in strategic decision-making scenarios. This framework is designed for complex network systems and has been validated through simulation results, showing improved cost reduction and service level compared to traditional stochastic methods.

articles.title: Computationally Efficient Spline-Based Modeling of DER Dynamics for Voltage Stability in Active Distribution Networks
articles.summary: The article proposes a novel data-driven approach for modeling the dynamic behavior of Distributed Energy Resources (DERs) in power systems, using B-splines to transform discrete system data into continuous functions. This approach simplifies traditional electromagnetic transient models and System Identification methods, reducing computational intensity and making it suitable for real-time operation. The proposed model achieves comparable performance to existing methods with significantly lower execution time.

articles.title: Menifee’s EV-Powered Homes: A New Era in Energy Independence
articles.summary: Menifee, California is pioneering a new era in energy independence by integrating electric vehicles (EVs) into six newly built homes. Each home uses a Kia EV9 connected to a Wallbox Quasar 2 bidirectional charger, allowing the vehicle's battery to power essential circuits during blackouts or periods of high electricity prices.

articles.title: Control Affine Hybrid Power Plant Subsystem Modeling for Supervisory Control Design
articles.summary: The article presents a modeling and control design framework for hybrid power plants, specifically adapted from existing paradigms for wind farms, solar plants, and battery models. The proposed framework allows for control design at the supervisory level using a control affine form, incorporating nonlinear control techniques to ensure safe and stable operation. The utility of this framework is demonstrated through a test case involving various input signals.

articles.title: Osaka Gas and Sonnedix prepare Japan’s ‘largest renewable battery storage facility’
articles.summary: Osaka Gas and Sonnedix are collaborating on the installation of what is claimed to be Japan's largest battery storage facility, which will be co-located with renewable energy generation. This project aims to increase the country's renewable energy capacity while providing a stable power supply. The facility will utilize battery technology to store excess energy generated from on-site solar panels.

articles.title: AGL seeks federal approval for 2,000MWh battery storage system in Queensland, Australia
articles.summary: AGL has submitted its Tuckeroo Battery project for federal environmental approval, which would see a 500MW/2,000MWh battery storage system built in Queensland, Australia. The project aims to provide renewable energy supply and grid stability. The submission is the first step towards obtaining federal approval.

articles.title: ‘You need to be co-located with battery storage’: Wärtsilä sees DC-coupling as essential for Australia’s solar future
articles.summary: Wärtsilä Energy Storage believes that DC-coupling between solar power and battery storage is essential for Australia's transition to renewable energy. The company sees co-location of battery storage with solar panels as critical for a seamless integration of intermittent renewables into the grid. This approach enables more efficient and stable energy supply.

articles.title: Australia’s home battery rebate processes ‘8,000 applications weekly’ as storage capacity surges
articles.summary: The Australian Cheaper Home Batteries Program is processing a high volume of applications, with 8,000 submissions per week, as demand for home battery storage capacity continues to surge. This indicates growing interest in renewable energy solutions and energy resilience. The program's success suggests a strong market response to incentives for sustainable energy upgrades.

articles.title: Cold beer, hot bricks: Heineken signs deals for 100MWh thermal energy storage system
articles.summary: Heineken has signed deals for a 100MWh thermal energy storage (TES) system with Rondo Energy, a TES startup. The project is located at a brewery in Portugal and marks the second 100MWh TES project announced by Rondo within weeks. This deal highlights the growing interest in using TES to stabilize power grids and reduce peak demand.

articles.title: ‘Collaboration, not isolation’: India’s path to becoming a global energy storage supply hub
articles.summary: India is exploring partnerships to establish itself as a global hub for battery manufacturing and energy storage, with successful collaborations playing a crucial role in achieving this goal. The country aims to leverage its growing economy and increasing demand for renewable energy to drive growth in the energy storage sector. India's success will depend on the ability of local industries to partner with international companies.

articles.title: Samsung SDI ramps ESS battery manufacturing in US to 30GWh, Tesla deal talks reported
articles.summary: Samsung SDI is increasing its energy storage battery manufacturing capacity in the US to meet growing demand, with a target of producing 30GWh by the end of 2026. The company's efforts come as the electric vehicle (EV) market faces challenges, including sluggish demand. This expansion aims to support Samsung SDI's growth and provide batteries for various applications.

articles.title: Building trust through action: How social license will shape the future of energy storage
articles.summary: The article discusses how social license, or the willingness of local communities to support a project, will play a crucial role in shaping the future of energy storage developments. Marie Cullen, head of procurement at Fluence Australia, highlights the importance of building trust with local stakeholders through transparent communication and community engagement. This approach is likely to be essential for securing funding, permits, and public acceptance for large-scale energy storage projects.
